altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: A Jacobite Lectionary, comprising lessons from the Old and New Testaments, principally for the Sundays of the whole year, in two parts. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 131 items.

msItem.title: A Jacobite Lectionary, comprising lessons from the Old and New Testaments, principally for the Sundays of the whole year, in two parts
msItem.note: Many of them are taken from the Apocrypha and from the Syriac version of the LXX.

listBibl.bibl: See Ceriani’s Memoir “Le Edizioni e i Manoscritti delle Versioni Siriache del Vecchio Testamento,” pp. 25, 26

msItem.title: Part I. Foll. 1—68. Title, fol. 1 b
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܢܬܐ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܩܕܡ.

msItem.title: The second Sunday after Epiphany
msItem.note: The third Sunday after Epiphany is omitted here, though given in its proper place in part II

physDesc.p: Vellum, 10 3/8 in. by 7, consisting of 121 leaves, the last of which is much stained and torn. The quires, 13 in number, are signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 24 to 34 lines.

collation.p: The quires, 13 in number, are signed with letters

item.p: Of 121 leaves, the last of which is much stained and torn

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 24 to 34 lines

handNote.desc: This volume is written, apparently, by two hands.
The second hand (commences at fol. 101 b), dated A. Gr. 1135, A.D. 824.
Rubrics had been left blank and wrongly filled up by a later hand.
Below is written, in a different hand.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The colophon, fol. 68 b, informs us that this lectionary was finished in the year 1135 (A.D. 824) in the church of Achudemes (at Harrān), at the expense of the congregation, under the direction of Mihr-Shabūr the son of Elias (the name of Dūmā is a later alteration; see Add. 14,486 and 14,487).

p.quote: ܐܫ̣ܬܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܦܘܪܫ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ̣. ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܡܐܐ ܘܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܚܡܫ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ. ܐܫܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܒܥܕܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܚܘܕܡܗ. ܐܬܥܒܕ ܕܝܢ ܒܫܘܬܦܘܬܐ ܕܟܠܗ ܟܢܫܐ. ܒܝܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܕܡܝܗܪ ܫܒܘܪ ܒܪ[ܕܘܡܐ.]

item.p: The first five lines of a subsequent note have been erased (see Add. 14,486 and 14,487); from the remainder we learn that the book was bound by a deacon named Isaac.
After the doxology, there are written in a smaller character the words:

The first of the two following notes, in the second column of the same page, states that George the son of Barnī, of Tagrït, and his son Jacob presented this volume to the convent of S. Mary Deipara; the second, that it was procured for the said convent by the monks Matthew and Abraham of Tagrīt.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
